question: 経由
sourceMnemonic: You <kanji>pass through</kanji> somewhere for a <kanji>reason</kanji>, so you're going <vocabulary>via</vocabulary> that place.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You learned this reading for <ja>経</ja> with the kanji, and you learned this reading for <ja>由</ja> with the word <ja>由来</ja>. If you need an extra reminder for that one, here's a mnemonic just in case:

If you're going <ja>via</ja> an unfamiliar place, I recommend you seek out a <reading>yu</reading>rt (<ja>ゆ</ja>) to stay in. Wherever it is you're going via, you can't go wrong if you stay in a yurt.
